{{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''EastEnders'' characters (2008)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2011}} The following is a list of characters that first appeared in the [[BBC]] [[soap opera]] ''[[EastEnders]]'' in 2008, by order of first appearance. All characters were introduced by executive producer [[Diederick Santer]]. He introduced four characters in January: [[#Mr Lister|Mr Lister]], a new market inspector; [[Christian Clarke]], the brother of [[Jane Beale]] and two members of the [[Branning family|Branning]] family, [[#Selina Branning|Selina]] and [[#Penny Branning|Penny]]. In March, he introduced [[#Jalil Iqbal|Jalil Iqbal]], a new love interest for [[Shabnam Masood]], and in April he introduced [[Ricky Butcher]]'s fiancÃ©e, [[#Melinda|Melinda]] as well as [[Bianca Jackson]]'s children, [[Whitney Dean|Whitney]], [[#Morgan Jackson King|Morgan]] and [[Tiffany Dean|Tiffany]]. Also in April he introduced [[Denise Johnson]]'s ex-husband, [[Lucas Johnson]], and [[#Opal Smith|Opal Smith]], the aunt of [[Gus Smith|Gus]] and [[Juley Smith]]. In May he extended the Johnson family and introduced Lucas's son, [[#Jordan Johnson|Jordan]] as well as introducing [[#Brenda Boyle|Brenda Boyle]], a new love interest for [[Charlie Slater]]. In July, he introduced two members of the long-established [[Mitchell family]], [[Archie Mitchell]] and [[Danielle Jones (EastEnders)|Danielle Jones]]. In August, he introduced [[#Callum Monks|Callum Monks]], the son of already established character [[Vinnie Monks]] and in September, he introduced [[Tony King]] as the partner of Bianca Jackson and also [[#Poppy Merritt|Poppy Merritt]], the new GP of Walford. November saw the only birth of the year, [[#Amy Mitchell|Amy Mitchell]], the child of [[Roxy Mitchell]] and [[Jack Branning]]. The final introduction of the year was [[Dotty Cotton]], [[Nick Cotton]]'s daughter. {{TOC limit|limit=2}} {{-}} ==Mr Lister== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series= EastEnders | name= Mr Lister | image= | portrayer= [[Nick Wilton]] | introducer= [[Diedrick Santer]] | classification= [[List of characters from EastEnders#Recurring characters|Present; recurring]] | first= 3 January 2008 | last= | years= 2008â | occupation = Market inspector | born= c. 1964 }} '''Mr Lister''', played by [[Nick Wilton]], is the market inspector at Bridge Street market, the successor of [[Marie Matthews]] ([[Susan Cruse]]). He makes his first appearance on 3 January 2008 when he sacks his assistant, [[Bradley Branning]] ([[Charlie Clements]]).{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a81130/its-the-day-of-kevins-funeral.html|title=It's the day of Kevin's funeral|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|date=3 January 2008|accessdate=17 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} He appears on a recurring basis thereafter, his next appearance being when [[Tamwar Masood]] ([[Himesh Patel]]) seeks approval for a new stall, which Mr Lister accepts. In August 2008, [[Billy Mitchell (EastEnders)|Billy Mitchell]] ([[Perry Fenwick]]) gets a job as the market cleaner but Mr Lister sacks him when he loses his cart. In October 2008, [[Ronnie Mitchell]] ([[Samantha Womack]]) phones him because [[Danielle Jones (EastEnders)|Danielle Jones]] ([[Lauren Crace]]) is selling stolen nightwear on the clothes stall. In May 2009, he closes down [[Stacey Slater]]'s ([[Lacey Turner]]) stall and in September 2009, he closes it again and gives it to [[Ryan Malloy]] ([[Neil McDermott]]). In February 2010, Stacey and her friend [[Becca Swanson (EastEnders)|Becca Swanson]] ([[Simone James]]) decide to set up a stall but Mr Lister turns them down as he does not like Stacey. Becca dresses up and pretends to be from Walford Council and tells Mr Lister that Stacey has lodged a complaint against him and makes legal threats. Mr Lister then gives Stacey her stall. In April 2010, Mr Lister is seen investigating [[Fatboy (EastEnders)|Fatboy]]'s ([[Ricky Norwood]]) van, as Fatboy is trying to sell T-shirts from the vehicle without a market license. In May 2010, [[Syed Masood]] ([[Marc Elliott]]) asks Mr Lister if he can start a market stall, and Mr Lister suggests a mobile phone stall. In October 2010, [[Kat Moon]] ([[Jessie Wallace]]) squirts water at him, so he orders Stacey to discipline or sack Kat, but Stacey refuses and squirts him as well, so he revokes Stacey's market traders' licence. In March 2011, Mr Lister offers Fatboy a month's trial on his own stall after Fatboy and [[Mo Harris]] ([[Laila Morse]]) argue over it. In April 2011, he complains to Billy that his stall is in the wrong position, but Billy says nobody cares. [[Whitney Dean]] ([[Shona McGarty]]) asks for her stall back, and they get chatting. He moans about his life as he gets abused by stallholders regularly, and his wife has left him so he rarely sees his two children. He invites Whitney for a drink and comforts her saying that her step father, [[Ricky Butcher]] ([[Sid Owen]]), is doing what is best for her. He gets up to leave but falls onto Whitney, so [[Janine Butcher]] ([[Charlie Brooks]]) threatens him and calls him a pervert. In May, [[Denise Fox]] ([[Diane Parish]]) asks Mr Lister to get involved with [[Patrick Trueman]] ([[Rudolph Walker]]) but Mr Lister says he has no say over the shop, which Patrick owns. In June, Whitney and [[Lauren Branning]] ([[Jacqueline Jossa]]) ask Mr Lister for a stall, but he is reluctant as Whitney lost a stall for not paying her rent. However, he agrees as long as the owed rent is paid and a month's rent is paid in advance. In July, Mr Lister issues Fatboy with a warning for kicking his own stall, but Fatboy decides to abandon his stall before he can be disciplined. He warns [[Eddie Moon]] ([[David Essex]]) about flytipping, and is threatened by Eddie's son [[Tyler Moon|Tyler]] ([[Tony Discipline]]). Lister later accepts a bribe from Eddie. In November, Mr Lister appears following reports that someone is selling Dutch Father Christmas toys, and asks [[Alfie Moon]] ([[Shane Richie]]) if he knows anything. Alfie denies this, although it is his relatives Tyler and [[Anthony Moon]] (Matt Lapinskis) who have done it. Anthony asks Fatboy to change them so they no longer speak Dutch, and when Lister sees Fatboy with one, it plays a jingle in Fatboy's voice. {{-}} ==Christian Clarke== {{Main|Christian Clarke}} '''Christian Clarke''', played by [[John Partridge (performer)|John Partridge]], is introduced to the show as a new gay character and the brother of [[Jane Beale]] ([[Laurie Brett]]) as the show's bosses had seen how popular [[Antony Cotton]] was in the role of [[Sean Tully]] in ''[[Coronation Street]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a79408/new-gay-character-to-join-eastenders.html|title=New gay character to join 'EastEnders'|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kimberley|last=Dadds|date=7 November 2007|accessdate=7 November 2007|location=[[London]]}} However, Partridge's character is not as [[effeminacy|camp]] as Cotton's, and is described as "very suave and a real charmer" and a "savvy, bright character [who is] very fun."{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediaselector/check/eastenders/av/characters_cast/interviews/john_interview?size=16x9&bgc=e3e1e1&bbram=1&nbram=1&bbwm=1&nbwm=1|title=John Partidge Video Interview|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=24 February 2008|format=video|location=[[London]]}} He made his first appearance on 17 January 2008. His main storyline is having an affair with Muslim character [[Syed Masood]] ([[Marc Elliott]]), while Syed is engaged to [[Amira Shah]] ([[Preeya Kalidas]]).{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a157415/enders-syed-for-gay-love-plot.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|title='Enders Syed for gay love plot|first=Kris|last=Green|date=28 May 2009|accessdate=28 May 2009|location=[[London]]}} ==Ashley Jennings== '''Ashley Jennings''' played by [[Tony Boncza]], is the fiancÃ© of [[Christian Clarke]] ([[John Partridge (performer)|John Partridge]]), who appeared in the episode broadcast on 17 January 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a82048/dots-terrorised-by-a-gang-of-yobs.html|title=Dot's terrorised by a gang of yobs|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|accessdate=19 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} He was described by ''[[Soaplife]]'' as Christian's rich "[[Age disparity in sexual relationships|sugar daddy]]".{{cite journal|journal=[[Soaplife]]|date=15 January 2008}}{{vague|reference needs expanding with issue number, page number, article title, etc.|date=April 2011}} In the episode, Ashley and Christian have a meal with Christian's sister [[Jane Beale]] ([[Laurie Brett]]) and her husband [[Ian Beale]] ([[Adam Woodyatt]]). Ashley leaves the meal early after Christian reveals that he was in love with Jane's ex-husband [[David Collins (EastEnders)|David Collins]] ([[Dan Milne]]). He and Christian break up, and Christian moves in with the Beales. {{-}} ==Tegs Teague== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name =Tegs Teague | image = | portrayer = [[Benjamin Smith (actor)|Ben Smith]] | creator = [[Diederick Santer]] | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former; guest]] | first = 17 January 2008 | last = 22 January 2008 | years =2008 | mother = [[Tina Teague]] }} '''"Tegs" Teague''', played by [[Benjamin Smith (actor)|Ben Smith]], is the main leader of a gang called the 'E20'. He appears between 17 and 22 January 2008{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a82122/tegs-stabs-jay.html|title=Tegs stabs Jay|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|accessdate=17 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} along with the rest of the gang. The gang harass [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]) by wolf-whistling at her and calling her a "zombie". [[Shirley Carter]] ([[Linda Henry]]) sees them and tells them to leave her alone. The gang, including Tegs' friend [[#Ziggy|Ziggy]] (Ashley Horne), steal DVDs from [[Winston (EastEnders)|Winston]]'s ([[Ulric Browne]]) market stall with the help of [[Jay Brown]] ([[Jamie Borthwick]]). Tegs asks Jay if he wants to join the gang and gives him a mobile phone so they can call each other. Jay later sneaks out and Tegs hands him a knife, which is found by Jay's father, [[Jase Dyer]] ([[Stephen Lord]]) and his girlfriend [[Dawn Swann]] ([[Kara Tointon]]). The next day, the gang steal several packs of cigarettes from the local shop, the Minute Mart. They harass Dot by making silent phone calls and knocking on her door and running away. Tegs pulls a knife on [[Minty Peterson]] ([[Cliff Parisi]]), who confronts the group of youths. After Jay criticises Tegs's harassment of Dot, they have a fight. After appearing to have reconciled their differences, Tegs is asked by his gang whether he is with them or Jay, at which point he stabs Jay in the leg, leaving him bleeding on the ground in the park. Tegs' mum, [[#Tina Teague|Tina Teague]] (Kerry Ann White) arrives before the trial to try and persuade Jay to drop the charges against Tegs but he does not and Tegs is sentenced in an off-screen trial on 29 February to two years in a [[Her Majesty's Young Offender Institution|Young Offenders Institution]] for his crime.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a89555/max-tells-tanya-he-wants-her-back.html|title=Max tells Tanya he wants her back|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=18 March 2011}} ===Development=== A show insider told ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' that the storyline in which Tegs stabs Jay is "easily one of the most shocking and controversial storylines ''EastEnders'' has ever done. It is not a decision bosses have taken lightly, but it is an issue that is top of the news agenda. We're going to tread very carefullyâit wonât be gratuitous. The plan is to screen the episodes in the usual slots before the watershed. Hopefully by showing the suffering gang violence can cause, some people may think twice about getting involved."{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/article661746.ece|title=Jay knifed by Walford hoodies|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|last=Robertson|first=Colin|accessdate=5 April 2011|location=London|date=7 January 2008}} This was to be the first teenage gang-related attack that ''EastEnders'' has featured. Kris Green from ''[[Digital Spy]]'' described him as 'out of control'. Ofcom received seven complaints about the stabbing episode.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/7206562.stm|title=EastEnders stabbing angers fans|work=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=5 April 2011|date=24 January 2008}} John Beyer, of the pressure group [[Mediawatch UK]], said, "The stabbing of Jay flooded in over 200 complaints after Watchdog had recently ordered a stop to soap violence. I think this shows that at a flagship programme such as ''EastEnders'' they are prepared to ignore public opinion, prepared to ignore the regulator and the complaints and carry on regardless." A BBC spokesman said, "''EastEnders'' has always tackled difficult issues and we acknowledge that some viewers could consider this storyline challenging. This is part of a long-running storyline that in no way glamorises the use of knives."{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-510010/200-complaints-flood-BBC-13-year-old-knifed-EastEnders.html|title=200 complaints flood in to BBC after 13-year-old is knifed in EastEnders|work=[[The Daily Mail]]|accessdate=5 April 2011|location=London|date=24 January 2008}} A BBC spokesperson responded to the complaints about the scenes being shown before the watershed: "The BBC has a strict set of editorial guidelines which all programmes must adhere to, to ensure that the violence portrayed was suitable for pre-watershed viewing." Kris Green from ''Digital Spy'' defended the episode saying, "I have to say that it wasn't as gruesome as I'd imagined it would be. There's no screaming, no scufflingâit's all quiet and it happens in about 10 seconds."{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/scoop/a84884/double-booking.html|title=Double booking|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|accessdate=17 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} {{-}} ==Selina Branning== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series= EastEnders | name= Selina Branning | image= | portrayer= [[Daisy Beaumont]] | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification= [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former; guest]] | first= 21 January 2008 | last= 1 February 2008 | years= 2008 | husband= [[Jack Branning]] (1997â2007)
James (2009â) | daughters=[[#Penny Branning|Penny Branning]] }} '''Selina Branning''', played by [[Daisy Beaumont]],{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/article646127.ece|title=Star Stories girl in Enders role |work=''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]''|publisher=[[News Group Newspapers]]|date=3 January 2008|accessdate=18 April 2011|location=[[London]] |first=Stuart |last=Pink}} is the ex-wife of [[Jack Branning]] ([[Scott Maslen]]), and mother of their daughter [[#Penny Branning|Penny Branning]] (Mia McKenna Bruce). This was Beaumont's second role in ''EastEnders'' as she previously played [[Helen Graham (EastEnders)|Helen Graham]] in 2000. She was listed by [[Digital Spy]] as a suspect in [[Max Branning]]'s ([[Jake Wood]]) hit-and-run.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a133139/eastenders-whodunnit-the-suspects.html|title='EastEnders' Whodunnit: The Suspects|work=''[[Digital Spy]]''|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=20 Ocotber 2009|accessdate=6 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} However, [[Lauren Branning]] ([[Madeline Duggan]]) was the culprit.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a138571/year-in-brief-2008-eastenders.html|title=Year in Brief 2008: 'EastEnders'|work=''[[Digital Spy]]''|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=17 December 2008|accessdate=6 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} She appears between 21 January and 1 February 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a84617/clare-is-thrown-back-into-the-square.html|title=Clare is thrown back into the Square|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Green|last=Kris|date=1 February 2008|accessdate=17 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} Selina is first heard when she leaves a message for Jack and [[Ronnie Mitchell]] ([[Samantha Womack]]) speaks to her on the phone. Ronnie later visits Selina and speaks to her about Jack not being allowed to see their daughter, Penny. It is revealed that Penny is in a wheelchair, paralysed from the waist down. Jack sleeps with Selina in his club's office and they are seen by Ronnie's sister [[Roxy Slater]] ([[Rita Simons]]). A week later, Selina phones Jack to say that she and Penny are leaving to live in France. On 1 December 2008, Jack tells Ronnie that Selina is engaged to remarry. It is revealed on 2 March 2009 that Selina got married over the weekend to a man named James and that Jack did not attend.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a147120/stacey-betrays-danielle.html|title=Stacey betrays Danielle|work=''[[Digital Spy]]''|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Green|last=Kris|date=2 March 2009|accessdate=5 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} {{-}} ==Penny Branning== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | image = | name =Penny Branning | portrayer =Mia McKenna Bruce | introducer = [[Diedrick Santer]] | classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former; recurring]] | first = 21 January 2008 | last = 18 April 2008 | years =2008 | born = 25 January 1998 | home= [[France]] | occupation=[[Student]] | family = [[Branning family|Branning]] | father = [[Jack Branning]] | mother = [[#Selina Branning|Selina Branning]] | aunts = [[Ronnie Mitchell]] | halfsisters = [[Amy Mitchell]] | halfbrothers = [[Richard Mitchell (EastEnders)|Richard Mitchell]]
[[James Branning]] | uncles = [[Max Branning]] }} '''Penelope "Penny" Branning''', played by Mia McKenna Bruce,{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/drama/smalldarkplaces/behind_the_scenes/cast/sdp_mia_mckennabruce_person_page.shtml|title=Small Dark Places-Mia McKenna-Bruce|accessdate=18 April 2011|work=[[BBC]]}} is the daughter of [[Jack Branning]] ([[Scott Maslen]]) and his first wife [[#Selina Branning|Selina Branning]] ([[Daisy Beaumont]]). She appears between 21 January {{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a82121/jay-causes-mayhem-for-dot.html|title=Jay causes mayhem for Dot|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|accessdate=17 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} and 1 February 2008, and returns from 15{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a93233/bianca-arranges-a-party-at-dots.html|title=Bianca arranges a party at Dot's|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|date=15 April 2008|accessdate=17 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} to 18 April 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a93236/stevens-pushed-to-the-limit-in-rr.html|title=Steven's pushed to the limit in R&R|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|date=18 April 2008|accessdate=17 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} Maslen who plays Penny's dad revealed that Penny will be returning to the serial intermittently, though she has not returned since her departure.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a92022/in-video-digital-spy-soap-awards-2008.html|title=In Video: Digital Spy Soap Awards 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=21 March 2008|accessdate=4 April 2011|location=[[London]]|format=video}} Jack's girlfriend [[Ronnie Mitchell]] ([[Samantha Womack]]) finds tickets for a ballet, which Jack says are for Penny as it is her birthday on the day of the performance and she loves dancing. Later, Jack finds a message on his answerphone from Selina, ranting about the birthday present. Ronnie answers the phone and meets Selina. At the house, while talking to Selina about the circumstances of her and Jack's relationship, Penny enters the room in a wheelchair. Selina asks Ronnie if she knows why Penny is paralysed from the waist down. Later, Jack tells Ronnie that when he was a police officer, he caught a drug dealer who deliberately hit Penny with his car when she and Selina were waiting at a bus stop, causing Penny's spine to be severed.{{cite news|url=http://www.atvnewsnetwork.co.uk/today/index.php/atv-today/462-serial-disability|title=Serial Disability|accessdate=29 April 2011|work=[[ATV Today]]|publisher=[[ATV Network]]|date=2 February 2009}} It is later revealed that it was due to Jack being a corrupt police officer and taking payment from a drugs baron in return for tip-offs. When Jack was unable to tip off the baron and he was arrested, one of his associates carried out the attack in revenge. Jack takes Penny and Selina out for Penny's birthday and they go back to Selina's flat and kiss. Selina reveals the next day how upset Penny was that Jack was not there when she woke up. Selina decides to move to France where her parents live and takes Penny with her. Penny visits Jack in April 2008 and is cold towards Ronnie, preferring her aunt [[Tanya Branning]] ([[Jo Joyner]]) with whom she goes shopping. Tanya cooks Penny a farewell meal, but Ronnie still struggles to bond with her. She decides that she does not want to return to France but is persuaded to go back to Selina by Jack. In March 2010, Ronnie asks Jack about Penny and he says she is doing fine without him and that Penny made the right decision to go to France.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a205370/ronnie-helps-out-a-lost-little-girl.html|title=Ronnie helps out a lost little girl|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|date=18 March 2010|accessdate=18 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} {{-}} ==Roger Grant== '''Roger "the Dodger" Grant''', played by [[Max Gold (actor)|Max Gold]], is a dodgy old friend of [[Mo Harris]] ([[Laila Morse]]). He appears on 5 February 2008, selling some clothes to [[Stacey Branning]] ([[Lacey Turner]]) for her stall. Mo insists that the stock is faulty, and tries to make the dye on a shirt run by pouring tea over it, and when Stacey's mother [[Jean Slater]] ([[Gillian Wright]]) tries to wash the tea stain out, the top gets ruined.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a86392/minty-throws-garry-out-the-flat.html|title=Minty throws Garry out the flat|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|last=Green|first=Kris|date=5 February 2008|accessdate=18 March 2011|location=[[London]]}} Gold also played [[Dougie Briggs]] in 1994, and his casting as Roger was criticised by entertainment website [[Digital Spy]]'s television critic Dek Hogan, as Briggs was "such an iconic role", calling it "an insult to the audience".{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/dekstvdiary/a89036/like-a-bullet-to-your-brain.html|title=Like a bullet to your brain|last=Hogan|first=Dek|date=11 February 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=3 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} {{-}} ==Edward Tunstall== '''Edward Tunstall''', played by [[Miles Anderson]], is a councillor who appears between 7 and 29 February 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a86394/deano-returns.html|title=Deano returns|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=29 March 2011|year=2008|first=Kris|last=Green|location=[[London]]}} He meets [[Ian Beale]] ([[Adam Woodyatt]]) at a council lunch and wants to throw a party, so decides to use Ian and [[Christian Clarke]]'s ([[John Partridge (performer)|John Partridge]]) events organising business, Fit for a Queen, to organise it. He assumes Ian is gay, and asks him out for a meal. During the meal, Ian admits that he is not totally in love with his wife, [[Jane Beale]] ([[Laurie Brett]]). Edward invites him to be his guest when he collects his [[MBE]] from [[Queen Elizabeth II|the Queen]], but due to Ian's daughter [[Lucy Beale]]'s ([[Melissa Suffield]]) disappearance, Ian is unable to attend. In January 2009, Tunstall is reported to be involved in a scandal with a young man, mentioned in the ''Walford Gazette'' newspaper. It is then revealed that he has stepped down as councillor. {{-}} ==Jalil Iqbal== '''Jalil Iqbal''', played by [[Jan Uddin]], is a friend of the Masood family who appears between 17 and 28 March 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a90605/tanya-finds-the-transfer-documents-ripped.html|title=Tanya finds the transfer documents ripped|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=19 March 2011}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a91690/jack-continues-to-charm-ronnie.html|title=Jack continues to charm Ronnie|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=19 March 2011}} Jalil was described as a "hunk" and it was said that he and [[Shabnam Masood]] ([[Zahra Ahmadi]]) would embark on "an affair of the heart".{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a89649/corks-and-eyes-are-a-poppin-in-enders.html|title=Corks and eyes are a' poppin' in 'Enders|last=Green|first=Kris|date=19 February 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=3 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} Family matriarch [[Zainab Masood]] ([[Nina Wadia]]) invites Jalil to stay with the family and work in their post office for a while, trying to set him up with her daughter, Shabnam. Shabnam is initially against this, as she remembers Jalil as a "geek" from her childhood, though when she sees him, she is attracted to him. Zainab sets them up with a romantic meal, listening in on their conversation using a baby monitor. Shabnam discovers that Jalil has a girlfriend, though Zainab sees a picture of her and says she is ugly and that her make-up looks like it has been done by [[Edward Scissorhands]]. Shabnam later bumps into Jalil on a night out in [[R&R (EastEnders)|R&R]] nightclub, where they flirt. Jalil and Shabnam later share a kiss, but during a conversation with the Masood family, he says that he thinks modern Muslim women like Shabnam provide "great entertainment" but are not marriage material. Zainab is offended by this and sends him away. {{-}} ==Melinda== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series= EastEnders | name= Melinda | image= | portrayer= [[Siobhan Hayes]] | creator= | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former; guest]] | first= 1 April 2008 | last= 4 April 2008 | years=2008 }} '''Melinda''', played by [[Siobhan Hayes]], is the fiancÃ©e of [[Ricky Butcher]] ([[Sid Owen]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a88467/my-family-star-joins-eastenders.html|title='My Family' star joins 'EastEnders'|last=Green|first=Kris|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|date=1 February 2008|accessdate=9 August 2010|location=London}} She appears between 1 April and 4 April 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a91692/the-square-turns-out-for-franks-funeral.html|title=The Square turns out for Frank's funeral|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=19 March 2011}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a91694/franks-family-scatter-his-ashes-in-the-gardens.html|title=Frank's family scatter his ashes in the gardens|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=19 March 2011}} Melinda comes to Walford with Ricky for funeral of his father, [[Frank Butcher]] ([[Mike Reid (entertainer)|Mike Reid]]). Throughout the day, she spends most of the time on the telephone to her father asking him for Â£25,000 as a property deposit, which he later fails to provide for her. She makes several attempts to introduce herself to [[Pat Evans]] ([[Pam St. Clement]]) and is dismissive when Ricky mentions his ex-wife [[Bianca Jackson]]'s ([[Patsy Palmer]]) absence from the funeral. At Frank's wake, it becomes clear that Melinda is only interested in what Frank has left to Ricky in his will. There is no financial gain, so Melinda quickly leaves in a bad mood. Later, Ricky announces that he and Melinda have split up, and Bianca tells Pat that Melinda was responsible for Ricky's lack of contact with their son [[Liam Butcher]] ([[James Forde]]). Speaking of the announcement of Melinda's arrival, an ''EastEnders'' source told [[Digital Spy]]: "Ricky returns to the Square for his dad [[Frank Butcher|Frank]]'s funeral and turns up with Melindaâbut is it true love or just a fling between them?" An insider told ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' that Melinda is "a classy bird, not at all like Ricky's mouthy old flame Bianca. But she's also really spoilt, a daddy's girl. Frank's funeral is the first time Ricky's family has met her and things don't go well."{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/754212/Eastenders-Siobhan-Hayes-My-Family-favourite-joins-Albert-Square-crew-as-Rickys-missus.html|title=Abi days come to the Square |work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|accessdate=5 April 2011|location=London|date=1 February 2008}} {{-}} ==Whitney Dean== {{Main|Whitney Dean}} '''Whitney Dean''', played by [[Shona McGarty]], is the adopted daughter of long-running character [[Bianca Jackson]] ([[Patsy Palmer]]), and was introduced in April 2008 when Palmer returned to the series after a six-year absence. Whitney was described as "a teenage drama queen, unable to engage brain before mouth and constantly finding herself in and out of trouble".{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a91777/in-pictures-meet-enders-jackson-five.html|title=In pictures: Meet Enders' Jackson Five|first=Kris|last=Green|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=18 March 2008|accessdate=18 March 2008|location=[[London]]}} She made her first appearance on 1 April 2008. Her storylines have revolved around her fractured family life, including her sexual abuse by Bianca's partner [[Tony King]] ([[Chris Coghill]]),{{cite news | work = [[BBC News]] | publisher=[[BBC Online]]|url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/7613307.stm | title = Will sex offender pilots work? | first=Dominic |last=Casciani|date=15 September 2008|accessdate=15 September 2008|location=[[London]]}} and a sexual exploitation storyline involving [[Rob Grayson]] ([[Jody Latham]]).{{cite news|url=http://www.pendletoday.co.uk/news/local-news/barrowford_actor_jody_latham_to_appear_in_eastenders_1_2928859|title=Barrowford actor Jody Latham to appear in âEastendersâ|work=Pendle Today|publisher=[[Johnston Publishing]]|accessdate=15 January 2011|location=[[Pendle]]}} The storyline with Tony won ''EastEnders'' a [[Royal Television Society]] Programme Award in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/news/news_20090318.shtml|title=RTS award success|work=EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|date=18 March 2009|accessdate=29 March 2009|location=[[London]]|archivedate=22 March 2009|archiveurl=http://replay.web.archive.org/20090322025526/http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/news/news_20090318.shtml}} ==Morgan Jackson-King== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series= EastEnders | name= Morgan Jackson-King | image= | portrayer=Devon Higgs | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification= [[List of characters from EastEnders#Recurring characters|Present; recurring]] | first= 1 April 2008 | years= 2008â | born= 23 June 2005 | spinoffs= ''EastEnders: Last Tango in Walford'' (2010) | home= 31 Albert Square | occupation= Student | mother=[[Bianca Jackson]] | father=[[Ray Dixon]] | adoptivefather= [[Tony King]] | stepfather= [[Ricky Butcher]] | halfbrothers=[[Liam Butcher]] | halfsisters =[[Natasha Butcher]]
[[Tiffany Dean]]
[[Whitney Dean]] (adoptive) | grandmothers=[[Carol Jackson]] | uncles=[[Robbie Jackson]]
[[Billie Jackson]] | aunts=[[Sonia Fowler]] | relatives=[[Pat Evans]]
[[Jim Branning]] }} '''Morgan Butcher''' (nÃ© '''Jackson-King'''), played by Devon Higgs, is the youngest son of [[Bianca Jackson]] ([[Patsy Palmer]]).{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a91777/in-pictures-meet-enders-jackson-five.html|title=In pictures: Meet Enders' Jackson Five|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|date=18 March 2008|accessdate=18 March 2008}} He made his first appearance on 1 April 2008. However, Higgs was not credited in the role until 8 September 2009.{{Citation needed|date=September 2009}} He is described by the ''[[Daily Mirror]]'' as "the most spoilt out of all of the [Jackson] kids. He's a boisterous, adventurous lad and can hold his own among Bianca's rabble. Morgan only eats chicken nuggets".{{cite news|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/showbiz/latest/2008/03/18/bianca-jackson-and-her-four-kids-move-back-to-eastenders-89520-20354690/|title=Bianca Jackson and her kids move back to EastEnders|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|date=18 March 2008|accessdate=18 March 2008}} Morgan is the result of a one-night stand between Bianca and a man who is unknown to viewers.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/characters/morgan-jackson-king.shtml|title=Morgan Jackson-King played by Devon Higgs |year=2011|work=EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=19 March 2011}} The man his family thinks is his father, [[Tony King]] ([[Chris Coghill]]), is serving a prison sentence for assaulting a teenager who had allegedly threatened Morgan's stepsister, [[Whitney Dean]] ([[Shona McGarty]]), though it is found out that Tony is not his biological father.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a107432/eastenders-morgan-whos-the-daddy.html|title='EastEnders' Morgan: Who's the Daddy?|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=5 July 2008|accessdate=18 July 2009}} Morgan along with Bianca, Liam, Whitney and Tiffany, have been called 'The Jackson Five'. Morgan, along with his mother, his half siblings [[Tiffany Dean]] ([[Maisie Smith]]) and [[Liam Butcher]] ([[James Forde]]), and his stepsister Whitney, are thrown out their house by their landlord. After initially spending a week in care, Morgan and the rest of his family move to [[Walford]], where they begin living with his great-grandmother [[Pat Evans]] ([[Pam St. Clement]]). The same week, a family party is held, where Morgan and his half-siblings meet the rest of their extended family. Bianca attempts to enter Morgan into a 'Beautiful Baby Competition' held at [[The Queen Victoria]] [[public house]], but is forced to withdraw him due to his age. A few days later he celebrates his third birthday by going to a restaurant with his family. Despite initially being thought to be the son of Bianca's partner Tony, it is discovered that this is not the case when Tony is released from prison, due to Morgan's ethnicity. Bianca reveals that Morgan was the result of a one-night stand she had with an unknown man but has always seen Tony as his father due to the fact that they met during her pregnancy and he has always been a consistent figure in Morgan's life. Morgan becomes ill and is diagnosed by [[#Poppy Merritt|Dr Poppy Merritt]] ([[Amy Darcy]]) with chicken pox. This leads to Pat having to vacate the family home as she had never had the illness. When Tony is arrested for having had a sexual relationship with Whitney, Morgan starts asking for his dad, leading the family to make up an excuse as they know that he will not understand what Tony had done. [[Janine Butcher]] ([[Charlie Brooks]]) and [[Ryan Malloy]] ([[Neil McDermott]]) use Morgan to raise money for their rent, pretending they are his parents and they are collecting money for a new playground. While trying to make a sandwich he accidentally squirts tomato ketchup on a hoody belonging to his recently deceased uncle [[Billie Jackson]] ([[Devon Anderson]]). Liam hides it and later tries to wash the stain out but their grandmother [[Carol Jackson]] ([[Lindsey Coulson]]) sees it and slaps him. Morgan starts to follow Liam around, fearing that he will die as well but Ricky and Janine reassure him. He runs away from home after Bianca is put into prison but is caught. {{-}} ==Tiffany Dean== {{Main|Tiffany Dean}} '''Tiffany Dean''', played by [[Maisie Smith]], is the daughter of long-running character [[Bianca Jackson]] ([[Patsy Palmer]]), introduced on 1 April 2008, when Palmer returned to the series after a six-year absence. Tiffany is described as having a "cute, butter-wouldn't-melt exterior", which "masks her somewhat mature understanding of adult matters. She sees all, hears all and knows all". She is also described as "a troublesome and cheeky lass" with a "feisty, red-head personality, which she no doubt inherits from {{sic|screenmum}} Bianca".{{cite news|url=http://www.echo-news.co.uk/news/local/display.var.2188732.0.the_new_eastenders.php|title=The new EastEnders|work=Echo|publisher=[[Newsquest Media Group]]|date=11 April 2008|accessdate=18 March 2002|location=}} For her portrayal of Tiffany, Smith won the 'Best Dramatic Performance for a Young Actor or Actress' award at the British Soap Awards in 2009.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/news/a154689/british-soap-awards-2009-the-winners.html|title=British Soap Awards 2009: The Winners|first=Kris|last=Green|coauthors=Kilkelly, Daniel|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=10 May 2009|accessdate=27 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} ==Lucas Johnson== {{Main|Lucas Johnson}} '''Lucas Johnson''', played by [[Don Gilet]], is the estranged father of established character [[Chelsea Fox]] ([[Tiana Benjamin]]) and ex-husband of [[Denise Fox]] ([[Diane Parish]]), who he later remarries. He has a son, [[#Jordan Johnson|Jordan]] ([[Michael-Joel David Stuart]]), from his previous relationship with [[Trina Johnson]] ([[Sharon Duncan Brewster]]). His profile on the official ''EastEnders'' website describes him as "an upstanding member of the community, a far cry from the youth he once was."{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/characters/lucas-johnson.shtml|title=Lucas Johnson played by Don Gilet|work=EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=7 November 2009|location=[[London]]}} His storylines include causing Trina's death and covering it up, murdering Denise's ex-husband [[Owen Turner]] ([[Lee Ross]]), and attempting to kill Denise. For his portrayal of Lucas, Gilet has received several award nominations, including Serial Drama Performance at the 2011 [[National Television Awards]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/news/a277960/national-television-awards-2011-nominees.html|title=National Television Awards 2011 - Nominees|last=Wightman|first=Catriona|date=21 September 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=21 September 2010|location=[[London]]}} He appeared from 3 April 2008 to 30 July 2010. ==Opal Smith== [[File:Rustie Lee.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Rustie Lee]], who portrayed Opal Smith.]] '''Opal Smith''', played by [[Rustie Lee]], is the aunt of [[Gus Smith]] ([[Mohammed George]]) and [[Juley Smith]] ([[Joseph Kpobie]]). She was introduced in February 2008 for two episodes, on 8 and 10 April 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a92605/shirley-tells-phil-she-wants-him-not-vinnie.html|title=Shirley tells Phil she wants him, not Vinnie|work=''[[Digital Spy]]''|accessdate=19 March 2011}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a92606/bianca-vows-to-get-her-kids-back.html|title=Bianca vows to get her kids back|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=19 March 2011}} Opal is first mentioned on screen in May 2007, when Gus has to go to Wolverhampton to look after her following a fall. In April 2008 she visits Gus out of the blue, as she has a coach ticket to use. She embarrasses him by assuming that he is dating [[#Keisha|Keisha]] (Suzie McGrath), and later gives him his mother's engagement ring. She was described as "the fiery aunt" by ''[[What's On TV]]''{{cite news|url=http://www.whatsontv.co.uk/news/2722|title=TV chef Rustie Lee heading for Walford|publisher=[[What's On TV]]|accessdate=19 March 2011}} and "the loud battleaxe aunty of Gus" by [[BBC Birmingham]]. Speaking of her arrival, Lee said, "I'm absolutely over the moon to think I'm going to be in the Square. I can't wait."{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a88549/rustie-lee-lands-eastenders-role.html|title=Rustie Lee lands 'EastEnders' role|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=19 March 2011}} She said the opportunity was tremendous and brilliant as she had always wanted to appear in ''EastEnders''.{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/birmingham/content/articles/2008/02/04/rustie_lee_eastenders_feature.shtml|title=Rustie Lee gets Eastenders role|publisher=[[BBC Birmingham]]|accessdate=19 March 2011}} {{-}} ==Inzamam Ahmed== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Inzamam Ahmed | image= | portrayer=[[Paul Bhattacharjee]] | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification= [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2010|Former;guest]] | first=13 May 2008 | last=1 January 2010 | years=2008â10 | brothers=[[Masood Ahmed]] | wife=[[Fatima Inzamam]] | sons=[[#Ali Inzamam|Ali Inzamam]] | daughters=[[#Jamila Inzamam|Jamila Inzamam]] | nephews=[[Syed Masood]]
[[Tamwar Masood]]
[[Kamil Masood]] | nieces=[[Shabnam Masood]] }} '''Inzamam Ahmed''', played by [[Paul Bhattacharjee]], is the brother of [[Masood Ahmed]] ([[Nitin Ganatra]]). He first appears on 13 May 2008,{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a95206/uncle-imzamam-visits-the-masoods.html|title=Uncle Imzamam visits the Masoods|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=13 May 2008|accessdate=28 March 2011}} and returns on 1 January 2010 for the wedding of Masood's son [[Syed Masood]] ([[Marc Elliot]]) and [[Amira Shah]] ([[Preeya Kalidas]]).{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a190013/zainab-confronts-syed-over-christians-claims.html|title=Zainab confronts Syed over Christian's claims|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=1 January 2010|accessdate=28 March 2011}} Inzamam first visits [[Walford]] to check up on his brother's family while Masood is in [[Karachi]] visiting their sick father. He is rude and sexist towards Masood's wife [[Zainab Masood]] ([[Nina Wadia]]) and daughter [[Shabnam Masood]] ([[Zahra Ahmadi]]), but praises his son [[Tamwar Masood]]'s ([[Himesh Patel]]) achievements. He is shocked to see that [[Jay Brown]] ([[Jamie Borthwick]]) has graffitied "Shabnam is a {{sic|hore}}" on the Masoods' wall. He later meets up with Zainab, and she asks him for money. He comes onto her, and she leaves, forcing her to consider selling her house. On the day before Syed's wedding to Amira, Masood takes Inzamam to dinner to ask if he can help with some money. Inzamam does not know who is getting married as nobody has told him about it and also does not know that Zainab is pregnant. Masood asks Zainab why she did not invite Inzamam to the wedding and she says she forgot, but he realises she did it deliberately. She tells him that Inzamam sees her as a fallen woman as she was previously married to [[Yusef Khan]] ([[Ace Bhatti]]),who returned a year later, when she met Masood, and he made many advances toward her. Masood orders Inzamam to stand and tells him that he knows what he has done. Masood returns Inzamam's money and says he is not invited to the wedding and is not welcome in their home and he walks out of their house with his wife, [[Fatima Inzamam|Fatima]] and children [[#Ali Inzamam|Ali]] ([[Omar Kent]]) and [[#Jamila Inzamam|Jamila]] ([[Sara Aisha Kent]]). {{-}} ==Jamila and Ali Inzamam{{anchor|Jamila Inzamam|Ali Inzamam}}== '''Jamila Inzamam''', played by [[Sara Aisha Kent]] and '''Ali Inzamam''' played by [[Omar Kent]], are the children of [[#Inzamam Ahmed|Inzamam Ahmed]] ([[Paul Bhattacharjee]]) and [[Fatima Inzamam]], and nephew and niece of Inzamam's brother [[Masood Ahmed]] ([[Nitin Ganatra]]). They make their first appearance on 13 May 2008, when they and their father attend a meal with Masood's wife [[Zainab Masood]] ([[Nina Wadia]]) and her children, [[Shabnam Masood]] ([[Zahra Ahmadi]]) and [[Tamwar Masood]] ([[Himesh Patel]]), as their father wants to check up on his brother's family. They return on 1 January 2010 for [[Syed Masood]] ([[Marc Elliot]]) and [[Amira Shah]]'s ([[Preeya Kalidas]]) wedding. along with their father and mother [[Fatima Inzamam]], when they are due to attend Syed and Amira's wedding, but they leave with their parents after Masood tells Inzamam he is not welcome. Unlike Inzamam and Ali, Jamila and Fatima are not creditied in this appearance.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00pl744|title=01/01/2010 Part 1|date=1 January 2010|accessdate=28 March 2011|publisher=[[BBC Programmes]]|work=[[BBC Online]]|location=[[London]]}} {{-}} ==Jordan Johnson== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Jordan Johnson | caption = | image= | portrayer=[[Michael-Joel David Stuart]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2010|Former; regular]] | first=23 May 2008 | last=21 December 2010 | years=2008â10 | born= 31 August 1996 | home = Outside Walford | occupation= [[Student]] | father=[[Lucas Johnson]] | mother = [[Trina Johnson]] | stepmother= [[Denise Johnson]] (2009â11) | stepsister= [[Libby Fox]] (2009â11) | halfsisters=[[Chelsea Fox]] | aunts=[[Gloria MacDonald]] }} [[File:Michael-Joel Stuart.jpg|150px|thumb|Michael-Joel David Stuart plays Jordan Johnson.]] '''Jordan Johnson''', played by [[Michael-Joel David Stuart]], is the son of [[Lucas Johnson]] ([[Don Gilet]]) and the half-brother of [[Chelsea Fox]] ([[Tiana Benjamin]]), who arrives on Chelsea's birthday with his father. He is described on the ''EastEnders'' website as a "cheeky chap" who "lights up the room with his winning smile". He is also described as a "talented boy who works hard at school".{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/characters/jordan-johnson.shtml|title=Jordan Johnson played by Michael-Joel David Stuart|work=EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=16 March 2011}} He first appears on 23 May 2008,{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a95789/sean-kidnaps-his-mother.html|title=Sean kidnaps his mother|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=23 May 2008|accessdate=28 March 2011}} and leaves on 21 December 2010.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a292829/ryan-and-stacey-go-public-at-the-pub.html|title=Ryan and Stacey go public at the pub|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=22 December 2010|accessdate=28 March 2011}} When Lucas arrives in [[Walford]], he tells Chelsea's mother [[Denise Fox]] ([[Diane Parish]]) that Jordan's mother [[Trina Johnson|Trina]] ([[Sharon Duncan Brewster]]) abandoned him shortly after he was born. He was in an incubator, addicted to heroin, as Trina was a drug addict. When [[Yolande Trueman]] ([[Angela Wynter]]) tries to get Chelsea to bond with Jordan, he finds [[cocaine]] in her handbag. Chelsea claims it is sherbet but Jordan is not deceived and tells her that their father helps drug addicts. When Jordan forgets his key to Lucas's flat, Yolande takes him to her B&B. Denise is not pleased that he is there but eventually enjoys his company. Jordan leaves with his father after locals blame him for [[Tony King]] ([[Chris Coghill]]) being allowed to work with children. Jordan and Lucas return a month later and stay at the B&B before preparing to leave for Leeds. After Denise proposes to Lucas, Jordan reveals that Lucas is still married to Trina. Unknown to Jordan and Denise, Trina had been looking for Lucas and he knows her whereabouts. She asks about Jordan and says she is no longer addicted to drugs, and he says he is going to marry Denise. Eventually, Jordan and Trina bond, but he is unhappy that Trina is excluded from a family holiday. He tells Trina about the holiday and she arrives to try to stop it. Jordan becomes friends with [[Ben Mitchell (EastEnders)|Ben Mitchell]] ([[Charlie Jones (actor)|Charlie Jones]]) and [[Abi Branning]] ([[Lorna Fitzgerald]]). Trina is killed while trying to seduce Lucas, and he leaves her in a shed on the allotment. Jordan tries to contact her on her mobile phone as she has promised to contact him. Jordan and Abi discover her body when they volunteer to clean the shed for [[Charlie Slater]] ([[Derek Martin]]). They decide to raise funds for a tree to be planted in Trina's memory in Albert Square's gardens, but unknown to everyone, Lucas murders Denise's ex-husband [[Owen Turner]] ([[Lee Ross (actor)|Lee Ross]]) and buries his corpse under the tree. Ben dares Jordan to drink alcohol that Ben stole from his family's pub. Lucas catches him and threatens to get Ben's father [[Phil Mitchell]] ([[Steve McFadden]]) involved but Jordan insists it was his idea and nothing to do with Ben. Jordan is annoyed when he sees Ben's sister [[Louise Mitchell|Louise]] kicking Trina's tree and she later blames him for locking her in a shed when it was actually Ben. Jordan swears on the bible that he did not do it, so Lucas believes him, and he tells Phil that he thinks Ben did it. This eventually turns out to be true, and Ben reveals that Jordan has been bullying him, so Phil and Lucas leave them with [[Minty Peterson]] ([[Cliff Parisi]]) to help them bond. After Minty leaves them alone, Jordan insults Ben, so Ben throws him to the ground and attacks him with a spanner, leaving him there. The next day he is found by Phil and taken to hospital where he is left in a coma with a fractured skull. Wracked with guilt, Ben confesses to the police that he attacked Jordan, while Jordan is brought out of his medically-induced coma. When he is discharged, his family throw him a party. In Jordan's police statement, he says that Ben attacked him for no reason. However, after Denise is visited by [[Jane Beale]] ([[Laurie Brett]]), who doesn't believe Ben would attack Jordan for no reason, she talks to Jordan and gets him to reveal that he had been bullying Ben. Jordan then decides to change his statement. When Owen's corpse is discovered under the tree, Jordan gets upset every time the tree is mentioned and reveals he had a dream where a hand came out of the ground. Lucas promises to get the council to replace the tree. Jordan and Abi argue when he feels she does not care and their friendship ends. He wonders if it is his fault that the people around him are dying. When the truth emerges that Lucas allowed Trina to die, killed Owen and kidnapped Denise, Jordan tries to stick by his father when the rest of the family run out, but then leaves in fear when he discovers that, rather than outright killing Trina, Lucas could have saved her but chose not to. Lucas is then arrested. When Jordan visits Denise with the rest of the family, he does not speak and just clutches his Bible. Finding it hard to come to terms with what has happened, Jordan eventually opens up to [[Patrick Trueman]] ([[Rudolph Walker]]), crying on his shoulder. The next day he worries that no one will want to be friends with him because they all know about Lucas. However, after he ends his romance with Abi, he is happy that they agree to remain friends. Jordan then says goodbye to his sister Chelsea and Libby, who are moving away after their ordeal in Walford. On his birthday, Jordan receives a card from his father, but asks [[Ricky Butcher]] ([[Sid Owen]]) to throw it away, and says he has to now look after Denise. However, Jordan is unable to speak to Denise about Lucas, so stays in contact with his aunt [[Gloria MacDonald]] ([[Michele Austin]]). Denise discovers they have been in contact for several months and allows Jordan to spend Christmas with her. Jordan is happy at his aunt's house, so Denise reluctantly lets him stay there into the New Year. {{-}} ==Maggie Townsend== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Maggie Townsend | image= | portrayer=[[Angeline Ball]] | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification= [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former;guest]] | first=27 May 2008 | last=11 June 2008 | years=2008 | occupation= Construction site boss }} '''Margaret "Maggie" Townsend''' played by [[Angeline Ball]], is [[Bradley Branning]]'s ([[Charlie Clements (actor)|Charlie Clements]]) boss. She takes over off-screen from [[Alex French]] ([[Pippa Hinchley]]).{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a89559/stacey-gives-in-to-temptation.html|title=Stacey gives in to temptation|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=|last=|location=[[London]]|accessdate=19 March 2011}} She made her first appearance on 27 May 2008{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a96246/stacey-rumbles-roxys-plans-to-leave-walford.html|title=Stacey rumbles Roxy's plans to leave Walford|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=27 May 2008|accessdate=28 March 2011}} and her last on 11 June 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a97212/may-descends-on-the-square.html|title=May descends on the Square|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=11 June 2008|accessdate=28 March 2011}} She appears when [[Sean Slater]] ([[Robert Kazinsky]]) steals a crane from the building site she is in charge of, and later goes on a corporate night out at local nightclub [[R&R (EastEnders)|R&R]], where [[Mickey Miller]] ([[Joe Swash]]) flirts with her, and she flirts with Bradley and [[Jack Branning]] ([[Scott Maslen]]). She also clashes with [[Chelsea Fox]] ([[Tiana Benjamin]]) and [[Tanya Branning]] ([[Jo Joyner]]), when Chelsea does her manicure wrong, then shouts at her in the beauty salon. She later invites Bradley to dinner, but he pretends to be ill and does not go, as he is not attracted to her. He confides in [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]), who goes to the restaurant without Bradley's knowledge, and argues with Maggie, telling her to "keep her filthy hands to herself." Maggie later sees Bradley at a singles' night at [[The Queen Victoria]] public house, and fires him for lying to her. He runs after her when she leaves, and she takes him home and they have sex, but Bradley does not get his job back. {{-}} ==Olly Greenwood== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Olly Greenwood | image= | portrayer=[[Bart Edwards]] | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification= [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former; recurring]] | first=9 June 2008 | last=21 August 2008 | years=2008 | mother=[[#Camilla Greenwood|Camilla Greenwood]] | birth = 1988 | occupation= [[Student]] }} '''Oliver "Olly" Greenwood''', played by [[Bart Edwards]], is the boyfriend of [[Lucy Beale]] ([[Melissa Suffield]]). He makes his first appearance on 9 June 2008{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a97210/denise-returns-to-walford.html|title=Denise returns to Walford|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=9 June 2008|accessdate=29 March 2011}} and his last on 21 August 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a122097/max-leaves-bradley-and-stacey-speechless.html|title=Max leaves Bradley and Stacey speechless|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=21 August 2008|accessdate=29 March 2011}} Lucy introduces her father [[Ian Beale]] ([[Adam Woodyatt]]) to Olly, whom she met when she was homeless and is five years Lucy's senior, and tells Ian that Olly is moving in or she will leave. Lucy tries to antagonise Ian by telling him that she and Olly are getting matching tattoos, and insinuating that they are sexually active, at which point Ian throws Olly out. Lucy later persuades her stepmother [[Jane Beale]]'s ([[Laurie Brett]]) brother, [[Christian Clarke]] ([[John Partridge (performer)|John Partridge]]) to let her use his flat to see Olly. Ian catches Lucy participating in foreplay with Olly, so takes him outside with Olly dressed in his underwear and makes everyone hurl sponges at him during a "Best of British" day on [[Albert Square]]. Ian then tells him to leave, which Olly does in an embarrassed state. Olly returns in August 2008 when Lucy throws a party at Christian's flat, then decides to go on the contraceptive pill after pressure from Olly to have sex with him. Ian finds out and visits Olly's mother [[#Camilla Greenwood|Camilla Greenwood]] ([[Joanna Van Gyseghem]]), inviting her and Olly to a meal at the Beales' house. Lucy is shocked to learn that Olly is not all he seemesâhe comes from a privileged background and is expected to attend [[University of Oxford|Oxford]] or [[University of Cambridge|Cambridge University]]. When this is revealed, Ian tries to set Lucy up for life by seeking Camilla's approval of Olly and Lucy's relationship. However, Camilla storms out of the house, followed by Olly. ===Development=== 19-year-old Edwards was cast in the role after being seen in a musical by one of the directors of ''EastEnders''.{{cite news|url=http://www.hemeltoday.co.uk/news/berkhamsted-news/student_makes_eastenders_debut_1_1201321|title=Student makes EastEnders debut|date=12 June 2008|work=[[Hemel Hempstead Gazette]]|publisher=[[Johnston Press|Premier Newspapers]]|accessdate=2 April 2011|location=[[Hemel Hempstead]]}} The casting was announced on 13 May 2008, when he was described as "mysterious".{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a95813/lucys-boyfriend-cast-in-eastenders.html|title=Lucy's boyfriend cast in 'EastEnders'|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=13 May 2008|accessdate=29 March 2011}} Speaking of his casting, Edwards said, "It is just amazing. Everybody is lovely on the set. I watch ''EastEnders''... but I never expected to be on TV with those people." He described his character as "a laid back person who takes each day as it comes" and as 'scruffy' by the official ''EastEnders'' website.{{cite news|url=http://web.archive.org/web/20090206024147/http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/characters_cast/characters/character_lucy_b.shtml|title=Lucy Beale played by Melissa Suffield|publisher=[[BBC]]|accessdate=20 July 2011}} Olly was also dubbed "the son of [[Swampy]]. {{-}} ==Brenda Boyle== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Brenda Boyle | image= | portrayer=[[Carmel Cryan]] | creator= [[Diederick Santer]] | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification= [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2009|Former;regular]] | years=2008â09 | first=9 June 2008 | last=14 August 2009 | brothers= [[List of EastEnders characters (2009)#Clive Robinson|Clive Robinson]] }} '''Brenda Boyle''', played by [[Carmel Cryan]], is introduced as [[Charlie Slater]]'s ([[Derek Martin]]) new love interest.{{cite web|url=http://holysoap.channel5.com/eastenders/news/charlie-to-say-goodbye-1980|title=Charlie to say goodbye?|date=8 August 2010|work= [[Holy Soap]]|accessdate=9 March 2011}} She appears from 9 June 2008 to 14 August 2009.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a168618/archie-makes-a-deal-with-jack.html|title=Archie makes a deal with Jack|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=14 August 2009|accessdate=29 March 2011}} [[Jean Slater]] ([[Gillian Wright]]) meets Brenda on a [[dating website]] and starts e-mailing her on Charlie's behalf. She visits [[Walford]] and Jean is forced to reveal the truth to an unsuspecting Charlie, and Brenda later discovers the deception. She is a member of the [[Salvation Army]] and plays the horn. When [[Shirley Carter]] ([[Linda Henry]]) makes a jokey off-hand comment about Charlie being a womaniser, Brenda leaves Walford, forgetting her horn. She gives Charlie a second chance when she comes to collect it, only to find out that [[Mo Harris]] ([[Laila Morse]]) has sold it.{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/1338741/Big-Mo-Harris-polishes-Brendas-horn-before-pawning-it-in-EastEnders-Laila-Morse-EastEnders-Soap-spoliers.html|title=Big Mo has horn for pawn|date=25 June 2008|accessdate=5 May 2011|location=London|work=The Sun}} She participates in a pub quiz with him and his family, and starts a relationship with Charlie, comforting him when he gets a [[spray tan]] to impress her and it goes wrong, leaving him orange. He later visits her in [[Clacton]], where she lives. Brenda buys Charlie a summerhouse for his allotment, but the concrete flooring is smashed by [[Suzy Branning]] ([[Maggie O'Neill]]), which looks like it will ruin the gift. However, the following day, Charlie sorts the problem so the concrete can be re-laid. Brenda helps raise money for [[Children in Need]] in [[The Queen Victoria]] but walks out of the pub after [[Linda Clarke]] ([[Lynda Baron]]) starts flirting with Charlie. On Christmas Day, [[Sean Slater]] ([[Robert Kazinsky]]) sings the song "[[Stop The Cavalry]]" to [[Roxy Slater]] ([[Rita Simons]]) as a Christmas present, and Brenda and a friend accompany him. When Charlie shared his concerns with [[Patrick Trueman]] ([[Rudolph Walker]]) that his and Brenda's relationship is moving too slowly, Patrick tells him to invite her to dinner and use candles to make it romantic. Charlie asks [[Winston (EastEnders)|Winston]] ([[Ulric Browne]]) for some romantic music but he gives him club music. After this, Charlie gives Brenda some drink but spills it on her. As he wipes it off, he touches her breast and is interrupted by [[Danielle Jones (EastEnders)|Danielle Jones]] ([[Lauren Crace]]). Brenda reassures Charlie that she has feelings for him but leaves with a worried look on her face. Brenda is supposed to join Charlie in pottery class but she calls him to say she cannot make it. This upsets Charlie, making him leave the class. Brenda is seen by Mo with another man, and she takes a picture of them embracing to show Charlie. The man is revealed to be her brother, [[List of EastEnders characters (2009)#Clive|Clive]] ([[Col Farrell]]). He tells her to tell Charlie about something before it is too late as it will be in two months. Brenda later announces to Charlie that she wants to end their relationship. Mo overhears this and confronts Brenda, who says she is emigrating, but promises to tell Charlie. A day later, Mo tells Charlie, and Brenda confirms she is moving to Madeira with Clive and his family.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a171060/potd-charlie-runs-in-front-of-a-bus-in-enders.html|title=POTD: Charlie runs in front of a bus in 'Enders|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Green|last=Kris|date=13 August 2009|accessdate=9 March 2011}}{{cite news|url=http://www.tv.com/eastenders/show/1505/viewer.html?flag=1&i=230&gri=1505&grti=101&tag=;viewer|title=Charlie says goodbye to Brenda, as she gets on a bus to leave|date=8 August 2009|accessdate=29 March 2011}} The couple decides to spend one last day together, and Brenda hints to Charlie that she wants to see more of him in Madeira. Charlie gets the hint at the last moment, and tries to stop the bus Brenda is leaving on. Brenda delays leaving, and the next day, after having a farewell meal in the house, [[Stacey Slater]] ([[Lacey Turner]]) and Mo give Charlie their blessing to go with Brenda and they leave in a taxi after receiving an emotional farewell. Whilst in Madeira, Charlie and Brenda end their relationship and he returns to Walford with another woman, [[Orlenda]] ([[Mary Tamm]]). {{-}} ==Archie Mitchell== {{Main|Archie Mitchell}} '''Archie Mitchell''', played by [[Larry Lamb (actor)|Larry Lamb]], is the father of established characters [[Ronnie Mitchell|Ronnie]] ([[Samantha Womack]]) and [[Roxy Mitchell]] ([[Rita Simons]]). He is also a love interest for [[Peggy Mitchell]] ([[Barbara Windsor]]), his brother's widow. Archie is introduced in a group of episodes filmed on-location in [[Weymouth, Dorset|Weymouth]], [[Dorset]].{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a93180/eastenders-sends-mitchells-to-dorset.html |title='EastEnders' sends Mitchells to Dorset|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=6 April 2008|accessdate=5 May 2011|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|location=[[London]]}} The audience learned that Ronnie had given a child up for adoption.{{cite episode|title=EastEnders Revealed: The Secret Mitchell|series=EastEnders Revealed|serieslink=EastEnders Revealed|credits=Adam Page (director, producer), Mark Cossey (executive producer)|network=[[BBC]]|station=[[BBC Three]]|airdate=3 April 2009|number=56}} Tim Teeman, critic for ''[[The Times]]'', has described Archie as "a thousand times more terrifying than [''EastEnders'' villain] [[Nick Cotton]]" and "a psycho in a golf jersey."{{cite news|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/tv_and_radio/article4438066.ece |title=EastEnders; Colin Jackson: The Making of Me; Snog, Marry, Avoid|work=The Times|accessdate=14 June 2008|location=London}} He made his first appearance on 8 July 2008. After originally leadving Walford following the revelation of his deceit and lies, Archie returns on 9 July 2009,{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a152520/enders-archie-to-make-summer-return.html|title=Archie to make Summer return|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|date=14 April 2009|accessdate=13 August 2009}} and his last appearance is as a corpse on 28 December 2009 after being murdered by [[Stacey Slater]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00pl715|title= EastEnders 28/12/2009|accessdate=6 May 2011|work=BBC Programmes|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|location=[[London]]}} ==Danielle Jones== {{Main|Danielle Jones (EastEnders)}} '''Danielle Jones''', played by [[Lauren Crace]], is introduced as a love interest for fellow new character [[#Callum Monks|Callum Monks]] ([[Elliott Jordan]]). Nineteen-year-old Danielle was described as a "naive blonde [...] easily taken in by Callum's smooth patter", arriving in [[Walford]] with "just a suitcase and a dream of a new life".{{Cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/article1443303.ece|title=Fair in Square|work=[[The Sun (newspaper)|The Sun]]|publisher=[[News Group Newspapers]]|date=19 July 2008|accessdate=19 July 2008|location=London}} It is later revealed that Danielle is the long-lost daughter of [[Ronnie Mitchell]] ([[Samantha Womack]]), and therefore a member of the soap's long-running [[Mitchell family]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/characters_cast/interviews/interview_lauren_c.shtml|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|date=10 October 2008|title=EastEnders Interview - Lauren Crace|accessdate=13 October 2008}} Her introduction was planned from 2007, when story producer [[Dominic Treadwell-Collins]] conceived the idea of two new Mitchell sisters, Ronnie and [[Roxy Mitchell|Roxy]] ([[Rita Simons]]). Danielle appears from 18 August 2008 to 3 April 2009, after she is run over and killed by [[Janine Butcher]] ([[Charlie Brooks]]). Her final episode was watched by 11.46 million viewers, and caused a notable power surge on the [[National Grid (UK)|National Grid]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a151673/enders-causes-national-power-surge.html|title='Enders causes national power surge|last=Green|first=Kris|date=3 April 2009|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=3 April 2009}} ==Callum Monks== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name= Callum Monks | image= | portrayer= [[Elliott Jordan]] | introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2009|Former; regular]] | first= 18 August 2008 | last= 6 March 2009 | years= 2008â09 | home= [[Southend]] | born=1989 | father= [[Vinnie Monks]] | halfsisters= Hayley Monks }} '''Callum Monks''', played by [[Elliott Jordan]], is the son of [[Vinnie Monks]] ([[Bobby Davro]]). He made his first appearance on 18 August 2008 and his last on 6 March 2009.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a122078/christian-struggles-to-cope-with-lucy.html|title=Christian struggles to cope with Lucy|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=18 August 2008|accessdate=6 April 2011}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a147125/callum-leaves-walford.html|title=Callum leaves Walford|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=6 March 2009|accessdate=6 April 2011}} Arriving in Walford in search of his father, Callum is instantly attracted to [[Stacey Branning]] ([[Lacey Turner]]). Unperturbed by her rejections, Callum attempts to woo Stacey, despite discovering that she is married. He briefly dates Stacey's friend [[Danielle Jones (EastEnders)|Dannielle Jones]] ([[Lauren Crace]]), but only to make Stacey jealous. Stacey continues to reject Callum, but after her husband [[Bradley Branning]] ([[Charlie Clements]]) angers her one night, she kisses Callum. Realising that her marriage is over, Stacey finishes with Bradley, allowing a casual relationship with Callum to begin. Their romance does not last, as Callum cannot bear to be around Stacey's mother [[Jean Slater]] ([[Gillian Wright]]), who has [[bipolar disorder]]. Blaming Jean for the relationship's demise, Callum aggressively tells her that she is ruining her daughter's life. When Stacey discovers this, she punches Callum and he reveals that his mother, who was also mentally ill, used to abuse him and lock him in cupboards when he was a child. He has scars on his legs from an incident where his mother attacked him with a wire coat hanger at the age of ten. Due to this and realising that Stacey would never leave Jean, Callum declares there is nothing left for him in Walford. He bids a final goodbye to Stacey and leaves to pursue Vinnie, who has already departed.{{cite news|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/latest/2008/07/19/exclusive-bobby-davro-quits-eastenders-after-just-one-year-115875-20654465/|title=Exclusive: Bobby Davro quits EastEnders|first=Mark|last=Jefferies|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|publisher=[[Trinity Mirror]]|date=19 July 2008|accessdate=21 December 2009}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a136269/vinnie-leaves-walford.html|title=Vinnie leaves Walford|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=1 December 2008|accessdate=17 April 2011}} The ''EastEnders'' website showed that Callum went to live with his Dad in [[Southend]].[http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/danielles_diary/ Danielle's Diary] {{Dead link|date=April 2011}} ===Development=== It was announced on 26 June 2008 that a new character, Callum, would be introduced to ''EastEnders'' as the son of already-established Vinnie. Callum was described as a "[[lothario]]".{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a104281/vinnie-monkss-son-cast-in-eastenders.html|title=Vinnie Monks's son cast in 'EastEnders|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=26 June 2008|accessdate=26 June 2008|location=[[London]]}} The role was given to Elliott Jordan, who had previously appeared in ''EastEnders'' in August 2005 as Gavin, an acquaintance of [[Leo Taylor (EastEnders)|Leo Taylor]] ([[Philip Dowling]]). Of his casting, Jordan said: "I am thrilled and really excited to be joining ''EastEnders''. Callum is a great part to play and I can't wait for him to make his mark in [[Walford]]." He also said it was an "honour". ''EastEnders''{{'}} executive producer, [[Diederick Santer]], commented: "Callum [...] will bring a breath of fresh air to Walford. Bright, twinkly, and with the gift of the gab, he'll get the women of Walford all of a flutter." Describing his character, Jordan said, "he's a very laid back and easy going character. He doesn't think too far ahead. He's a bit of a Casanova, definitely a jack the lad. He's very confident and streetwise and he reads people and situations very well, which allows him to get what he wants."{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/interviews/a121594/elliott-jordan-callum-monks-eastenders.html|title=Elliott Jordan (Callum Monks, 'EastEnders')|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=12 August 2008|accessdate=6 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} Jordan said that one of the writers told him that Callum reminded him of [[Vincent Chase]] in ''[[Entourage (TV series)|Entourage]]''. Callum was listed by [[Ladbrokes]] as a contender for the father of [[Heather Trott]]'s ([[Cheryl Fergison]]) baby, and was ranked by them as an outsider with odds of 16/1.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a168056/betting-opens-on-eastenders-whodunnit.html|title=Betting opens on 'EastEnders' whodunnit|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=29 July 2009|accessdate=6 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} He was also named by website [[Digital Spy]] as a possible suspect in [[Max Branning]]'s ([[Jake Wood]]) hit-and-run.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a132926/enders-max-in-hit-and-run-whodunnit.html|title=Exclusive: 'Enders Max in hit-and-run whodunnit|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=20 Ocotber 2009|accessdate=6 April 2011}} It was reported on 20 January 2009 that the character was to depart from the series in March 2009.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a144145/callum-monks-to-leave-eastenders.html|title=Callum Monks to leave 'EastEnders'|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=22 January 2009|accessdate=6 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} An ''EastEnders'' insider told Digital Spy, "Viewers will learn a little more about Callum before he leaves Albert Square behind." Speaking of his departure, Jordan said: "I've had a really great time at ''EastEnders'' and I've enjoyed working with all the cast. I've loved every minute of it and I'm looking forward to trying new things." {{-}} ==Tony King== {{Main|Tony King}} '''Tony King''', played by [[Chris Coghill]], is the partner of established character [[Bianca Jackson]] ([[Patsy Palmer]]), and a father-figure to her four children. He made his first appearance on 12 September 2008. It was reported in July 2008 that Tony would be arriving in the serial as part of a [[child sexual abuse]] storyline involving Bianca's adopted daughter [[Whitney Dean]] ([[Shona McGarty]]).{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a106462/child-sex-abuse-plot-for-enders.html|title=Child sex abuse plot for 'Enders|first=Kris|last=Green|date=2 July 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|location=[[London]]|accessdate=29 October 2009}} [[BBC News]] described the plot as an ongoing "predatory paedophile storyline", noting that this was the first time this subject matter had been tackled by a UK soap opera.{{cite news|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/7613307.stm|title=Will sex offender pilots work?|first=Dominic|last=Casciani|date=15 September 2008|accessdate=15 September 2008|location=[[London]]}} The ''[[Daily Mirror]]''{{'s}} Beth Neil branded the plot strand "one of the darkest and most disturbing storylines ''EastEnders'' has ever attempted",{{cite news|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/news-old/top-stories/2008/09/26/exclusive-eastenders-tony-king-and-the-other-most-evil-characters-in-soap-115875-20753242/|title=Exclusive: EastEnders' Tony King and the other most evil characters in soap|first=Beth|last=Neil|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|publisher=[[Trinity Mirror]]|date=26 September 2008|accessdate=6 November 2008|location=[[London]]}} with critic [[Jim Shelley (TV critic)|Jim Shelley]] deeming it to be a "new low" for ''EastEnders''.{{cite news|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/tv-entertainment/archive/jim-shelley/2008/09/15/new-low-of-the-week-eastenders-115875-20737944/|title=New low of the week: EastEnders|first=Jim|last=Shelley|authorlink=Jim Shelley (TV critic)|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|publisher=[[Trinity Mirror]]|date=15 September 2008|accessdate=6 November 2008|location=[[London]]}} Tony sexually abuses Whitney, and begins grooming her school-friend [[Lauren Branning]] ([[Madeline Duggan]]), before his predatory nature is uncovered and he is arrested for his crimes. Tony appeared between 12 September and 12 December 2008 and returned in December 2009 to stand trial. The [[NSPCC]] praised the storyline for "helping to raise awareness of the hidden nature of sexual abuse".{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/media/2008/jul/02/bbc.television|title=EastEnders to tackle child sex abuse|first=Leigh|last=Holmwood|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]]|date=2 July 2008|accessdate=6 November 2008|location=[[London]]}} The storyline also gained ''EastEnders'' a [[Royal Television Society]] Programme Award in March 2009 in the Soap and Continuing Drama category. ==Amir Khan== '''Amir Khan''', played by [[Alton Letto]], is an estate agent and colleague of [[Bradley Branning]] ([[Charlie Clements (actor)|Charlie Clements]]). He appears between 22 September and 6 November 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a130130/bianca-asks-tony-to-marry-her.html|title=Bianca asks Tony to marry her|last=Green|first=Kris|date=22 September 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=7 April 2011|location=London}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a133782/bradley-visits-max-in-hospital.html|title=Bradley visits Max in hospital|last=Green|first=Kris|date=6 November 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=7 April 2011|location=London}} He attends a sales pitch with Bradley and they sell all the flats available. To celebrate, they go to Fargo's restaurant, and are joined by Bradley's wife [[Stacey Slater]] ([[Lacey Turner]]). Amir tells Bradley and Stacey that he has two children, and has booked an adventure holiday with his wife as they have not had time away from the children for two years. He receives a telephone call from his wife telling him one of the children is ill, and is forced to cancel the holiday. This makes Stacey realise that she does not want children at the time as she feels she is too young. Bradley and Stacey take Amir and his wife's places on the holiday.
