Amir later shows [[Sean Slater]] ([[Robert Kazinsky]]) and his wife [[Roxy Slater|Roxy]] ([[Rita Simons]]) a home, and is supposed to go inside and show them round, but Sean intimidates him into staying outside. {{-}} ==Poppy Merritt== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Poppy Merritt | image= | portrayer=[[Amy Darcy]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2009|Former; regular]] | first=22 September 2008 | last=30 April 2009 | years=2008â09 | occupation= [[Trainee]] [[pathologist]] }} '''Doctor Poppy Merritt''' played by [[Amy Darcy]], is the [[general practitioner]] for [[Walford]], succeeding [[May Wright]].{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a98995/the-millers-house-explodes.html|title=The Millers' house explodes|last=Green|first=Kris|date=18 June 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=8 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} She made her first appearance on 22 September 2008, and her last on 30 April 2009.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a153059/zainab-warns-janine-off-syed.html|title=Zainab warns Janine off Syed|last=Green|first=Kris|date=30 April 2009|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=8 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} Poppy is first seen diagnosing [[#Morgan Jackson-King|Morgan Jackson-King]] ([[Devon Higgs]]) with [[chicken pox]], and she assumes Morgan's mother [[Bianca Jackson]] ([[Patsy Palmer]]) is married to [[Tony King]] ([[Chris Coghill]]), which puts the idea of marriage in Bianca's head. She sees [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]) when she has [[food poisoning]], and connects it to unchilled food sold by [[Patrick Trueman]] ([[Rudolph Walker]]) at his shop, the Minute Mart. She says it is her duty to report Patrick and his wife [[Yolande Trueman]] ([[Angela Wynter]]) to [[environmental health]]. Whilst cycling past [[Pat Evans]]'s ([[Pam St Clement]]) house, she sees Bianca shouting at her adopted daughter [[Whitney Dean]] ([[Shona McGarty]]) for being miserable. Poppy tries to talk to Whitney, who admits to feeling suicidal so Poppy tells Bianca that Whitney should see to a psychiatrist. Bianca disagrees initially but after realising Whitney needs professional help, she agrees and Poppy refers Whitney to a psychiatrist. The next day, Poppy leaves Bianca a message asking her to rearrange the psychiatrist's appointment after Whitney fails to attend. Poppy receivs an emergency call-out to check on pregnant [[Roxy Slater]] ([[Rita Simons]]) after she has a fall at [[Walford East tube station]]. Later, Poppy tells Roxy that she and her baby are fine. Later, a removal van is seen outside the surgery with a man removing the placard with Poppy's name on it. Poppy helps [[Heather Trott]] ([[Cheryl Fergison]]) after she has an asthma attack, and notices her breasts are sore so advises that Heather go to a clinic, which she does and finds out she's pregnant.{{cite news|url=http://www.nowmagazine.co.uk/gallery/gallery-specials/11768/3/0/see-pictures-eastenders-gossip-eastenders-heather-trott-s-asthma-attack-leads-to-a-shocking-revelation/1/|title=EastEnders: Heather Trottâs asthma attack leads to a shocking revelation|work=[[NOW (British magazine)|Now]]|publisher=[[IPC Media]]|accessdate=8 April 2011}} Poppy leaves Walford to retrain as a pathologist. {{-}} ==Lee Thompson== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Lee Thompson | image= | portrayer=[[Carl Ferguson]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former;guest]] | first=2 October 2008 | last=10 October 2008 | years=2008 }} '''Lee Thompson''' played by [[Carl Ferguson]], was a former school friend of [[Ronnie Mitchell]] ([[Samantha Womack]]). It was revealed in October 2008 that Ferguson would be playing the part and the role would see him 'become involved in a tangled love affair'.{{cite news|url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/luton-dunstable/carl_joins_cast_of_eastenders_1_1094954|title=Carl joins cast of EastEnders |date=9 October 2008|accessdate=8 April 2011}} He appeared from 2 to 10 Ocotber 2008.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a130817/bradley-wishes-max-dead.html|title=Bradley wishes Max dead|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=2 Ocotber 2008|accessdate=7 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a131395/danielles-secret-is-revealed.html|title=Danielle's secret is revealed|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=10 Ocotber 2008|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} He first appeared when Ronnie attended a school reunion, with [[Christian Clarke]] ([[John Partridge (performer)|John Partridge]]) posing as her husband. Lee revealed he is the best friend of [[Joel Reynolds]] ([[Cavan Clerkin]]), the father of Ronnie's daughter. He revealed that Joel knew about the school reunion but wouldn't be coming. Lee also realised that Christian was not Ronnie's husband and was in fact gay, so slid his own contact details into Christian's blazer pocket. Christian later went out for a drink with him and got Joel's contact details for Ronnie. Over the next few days Lee and Christian started a relationship, this was thanks to Christian's sister [[Jane Beale]] ([[Laurie Brett]]) sending Lee a text from Christian's phone. A few days into this relationship, Lee said that he was surprised he was attracted to Christian, as he tended to prefer younger men. They later kiss but are told by [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]) that she is as liberal as the next person, but does not approve of canoodling in public places.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1075617/Complaints-pour-BBC-EastEnders-screens-gay-kiss-watershed.html|title=Complaints pour into BBC after EastEnders screens gay kiss before the watershed|date=9 October 2008|work=[[The Daily Mail]]|accessdate=8 April 2011|location=London}} Christian later invited Lee for a lunch with some 'friends', Jane and [[Roxy Mitchell]] ([[Rita Simons]]), who had both insisted on meeting Lee. However, Lee ended up being rude to both Jane and Roxy, and later left while Christian was out buying wine, telling Jane and Roxy that Christian was too old for him and they ended their relationship. ===Reception=== After screening the kiss on 7 Ocotber 2008 between Lee and Christian 145 complaints were made after screening the kiss before the watershed.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a131389/its-the-day-of-jases-funeral.html|title=It's the day of Jase's funeral|date=7 October 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=17 April 2011}} It was described as 'offensive'. One person said to the ''[[Daily Mail]]'','I am appalled by the display of homosexual kissing before the watershed shown on EastEnders.'This is disgraceful whilst young children are watching and sets the wrong example.'Another wrote: 'I had to explain to my seven-year-old son what was happening.'He now thinks he is gay because he kisses his dad.'I think pre-watershed standards have been irresponsibly lowered in recent years.' Writing on the [[Points of View]] message board, one viewer said: "I am appalled by the display of homosexual kissing before the watershed shown on EastEnders. This is disgraceful whilst young children are watching and sets the wrong example." Though one viewer said, "I don't see what the fuss is about, given the context of their kissing and messing about and the way it was portrayed." The BBC defended it though saying, {{blockquote|'EastEnders aims to reflect real life, and this means including and telling stories about characters from many different backgrounds, faiths, religions and sexualities."We approach our portrayal of homosexual relationships in the same way as we do heterosexual relationships. In this instance, Christian is enjoying the first flush of romance and we've shown him being affectionate with his new boyfriend in the same way any couple would."We also aim to ensure that depictions of affection or sexuality between couples are suitable for pre-watershed viewing. We believe that the general tone and content of EastEnders is now widely recognised, meaning that parents can make an informed decision as to whether they want their children to watch.'{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a132248/enders-receives-complaints-over-gay-kiss.html|title='Enders receives complaints over gay kiss|date=9 October 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=17 April 2011}}}} Gareth McLean from [[The Guardian]] defended the kiss saying,Who are the people that complain about gay kissing in EastEnders? Don't they have anything better to do? Other than sell their daughters into slavery, kill their neighbour for working the Sabbath and stone infidels, I mean. ("Day 44 in the Old Testament House and it's time to burn a witch!"). Every time there's a bit of man-on-man kissage in Walford, the BBC gets complaints that "this filth", or words to that effect, shouldn't be on the telly. "How do I explain this to my child?" runs the gist of some of the gripes. He finished of saying 'Let's congratulate the [[BBC]]'.{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/culture/tvandradioblog/2008/oct/22/eastenders-gay-kissing|title=Let's congratulate the BBC on gay kissing in EastEnders|date=22 October 2008|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=London|first=Gareth|last=McLean}} {{-}} ==Stuart Turner== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Stuart Turner | image= | portrayer=[[Ray MacAllan]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former;recurring]] | first=27 October 2008 | last=11 November 2008 | years=2008 | occupation=[[Detective]] }} '''Detective Inspector Stuart Turner''' played by [[Ray MacAllan]], first arrived in Walford along with [[Kenny Morris (EastEnders)|Kenny Morris]] ([[Ryan Philpott]]) after [[Max Branning]] ([[Jake Wood]]) reported a burglary at his home. He made his first appearance on 27 Ocotber and his last on 11 November 2008.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a133129/jack-is-arrested.html?rss|title=Jack is arrested|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=27 Ocotber 2008|accessdate=7 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a134438/seans-seething-over-archies-interference.html|title=Sean's seething over Archie's interference|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=11 November 2008|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} After Sergeant Morris found bullet holes in the wall, Max said that they were the work of his brother [[Jack Branning]] ([[Scott Maslen]]). This however turned out to be a ploy of his in order to prevent Jack moving away to France with Max's wife [[Tanya Branning]] ([[Jo Joyner]]) and their three children. As a result Jack was arrested for attempted murder, but was later released due to lack of evidence. The gun had been found by Turner, however he later met Jack and handed the gun over to him, as he had respect for him as a former police officer. He later appeared after Max was mowed down by a moving car. He was worried about being discovered for giving Jack the gun, but Jack assured him that he was safe. However things got worse for him when [[Samantha Keeble]] ([[Alison Newman]]) turned up and announced that she was taking over the case of the Branning brothers' feud. After Tanya confessed to the hit and run and later refused bail, Jack enlisted DI Turner to help find the witness of Max's hit-and-run. He was reluctant, but after being blackmailed by Jack over his involvement with the "missing" gun, he relented and later revealed that the witness was [[Stacey Slater]] ([[Lacey Turner]]). {{-}} ==Kendra Hills-Smythe== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Kendra Hills-Smythe | image= | portrayer=[[Rebecca Egan]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2009|Former;recurring]] | first=11 November 2008 | last=10 April 2009 | years=2008â09 | occupation=[[Solicitor]] }} '''Kendra Hills-Smythe'''{{Cite news|url=http://www.spotlight.com/interactive/cv/1/a828/F20981.html|title=REBECCA EGAN|accessdate=17 April 2011}} played by [[Rebecca Egan]], was a solicitor employed by [[Jack Branning]] ([[Scott Maslen]]) to defend his partner [[Tanya Branning]] ([[Jo Joyner]]). She first appeared on 11 November and made two brief appearances on 1 December 2008 and 2 January 2009.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a137643/tanya-appears-in-court.html|title=Tanya appears in court|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=2 January 2009|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} She returned between the 7 and the 10 April 2009.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a151002/laurens-court-case-begins.html|title=Lauren's court case begins|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=7 April 2009|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a151008/archies-bound-and-gagged-in-the-arches.html|title=Archie's bound and gagged in the Arches|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=10 April 2009|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} In the upcoming case, Tanya had been arrested for attempted murder on her estranged husband [[Max Branning]] ([[Jake Wood]]). Despite promising Jack Tanya's freedom and helping her client in every way she could in order to see that she would be given bail, she admitted to Jack that Tanya didn't stand a chance of getting released. This proved true when Tanya's bail application was denied later that day. She later appeared, when she visited Tanya in prison to inform her that Max is concerned she is covering for Jack. However, this has been proven incorrect, although it has been revealed that Tanya is covering for her daughter, [[Lauren Branning]] ([[Madeline Duggan]]) . She returned to accompany Tanya in court, she asked Tanya to think about what her plea would be.When the truth about Lauren was revealed, she asked Kendra to contact social services because she felt that she will only make things worse for her family. She appeared later when she seemingly attended Lauren's court appearance. {{-}} ==Amy Mitchell== {{Redirect|Amy Mitchell|the character originally named Amy Mitchell|Danielle Jones (EastEnders)}} {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name= Amy Mitchell | image= | portrayer= Kamil Lipka-Kozanka
Natalia Lipka-Kozanka | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of characters from EastEnders#Recurring characters|Present; recurring]] | first= 17 November 2008 | last= | years= 2008â | born=14 November 2008 | home= 29b Albert Square | family = [[Mitchell family|Mitchell]]/[[Branning family|Branning]] | father= [[Jack Branning]] | mother=[[Roxy Mitchell]] | stepfather= [[Sean Slater]] (2008â09) | halfsisters= [[Penny Branning]] | halfbrothers = [[Richard Mitchell (EastEnders)|Richard Mitchell]]
[[James Branning]] | cousins=[[Danielle Jones (EastEnders)|Danielle Jones]]
[[James Branning]] | aunts=[[Ronnie Mitchell]] | uncles=[[Danny Mitchell (EastEnders)|Danny Mitchell]] | grandmothers = [[Glenda Mitchell]] | grandfathers = [[Archie Mitchell]]
[[Jim Branning]] }} '''Amy Christina Margaret Mitchell''' (nÃ©e '''Slater''') played by Kamil Lipka-Kozanka and Natalia Lipka-Kozanka, is the daughter of [[Roxy Mitchell]] ([[Rita Simons]]) and [[Jack Branning]] ([[Scott Maslen]]). She made her first appearance on 14 November 2008, the episode in which she is born.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a135142/roxy-goes-into-premature-labour.html|title=Roxy goes into premature labour|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=17 November 2008|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} For the first few weeks of her life, she is raised as the daughter of Roxy's husband [[Sean Slater]] ([[Robert Kazinsky]]) as he and Jack are unaware of Amy's true paternity. Amy is born two months premature and is put on a ventilator from birth. She is named after her presumed-dead cousin (now known as [[Danielle Jones (EastEnders)|Danielle Jones]] ([[Lauren Crace]]), the daughter of Roxy's sister, [[Ronnie Mitchell]] ([[Samantha Womack]]). Roxy initially decides to raise Amy with her friend [[Christian Clarke]] ([[John Partridge (performer)|John Partridge]]), after Sean misses Amy's birth but changes her mind when she and Sean reconcile. Jack asks Roxy for a paternity test, aware that Amy may be his daughter. It transpires that this is so on Christmas Day 2008 which leads to Sean abducting Amy. There is a fierce argument when Sean is found with Amy which leads to Sean leaving and Amy is returned to Roxy by Sean's sister [[Stacey Slater]] ([[Lacey Turner]]) on New Year's Day. Jack then spends more time with Amy and Ronnie decides Amy should be Christened and Roxy agrees. Amy's godfather is Christian and her godmother is her step-grandmother [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]), although Ronnie is originally meant to be her godmother, but gets drunk and turns up late to the ceremony.{{Cite news|url=http://www.nowmagazine.co.uk/gallery/gallery-specials/11810/3/2/see-pictures-eastenders-ronnie-mitchell-gets-drunk-and-ruins-her-niece-amy-slater-s-christening/1/|title=EastEnders: Ronnie Mitchell ruins Amy Slater's christening|work=[[NOW (British magazine)|Now]]|accessdate=17 April 2011}} Christian and his partner [[Syed Masood]] ([[Marc Elliot]]) look after Amy for a day and decide that they want a child. While Amy is being looked after by Ronnie, she draws a picture, which upsets Ronnie has Ronnie interprets it as including her son who died. Amy escapes from the house, which leads to everyone discovering Ronnie has been bailed from prison after swapping her dead baby [[James Branning|James]] with [[Kat Moon]]'s ([[Jessie Wallace]]) healthy son [[Tommy Moon|Tommy]]. Amy also escapes when Roxy's boyfriend [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]] ([[Steve John Shepherd]]) leaves the door open. Amy is almost hit by [[Carol Jackson]]'s ([[Lindsey Coulson]]) car but is saved by [[Eddie Moon]] ([[David Essex]]). When Amy suffers a fall at home, Roxy thinks nothing of it. Roxy goes on a night out with friends, leaving [[Ben Mitchell (EastEnders)|Ben Mitchell]] (Joshua Pascoe) babysitting Amy. When he leaves Amy alone for a while to get a DVD from Jack's flat, Amy runs herself a bath, gets in and almost drowns. When Ben discovers her, [[Yusef Khan|Dr Yusef Khan]] ([[Ace Bhatti]]) is called and he revives her. Amy is taken to hospital in a critical condition. She recovers, but she is found to have a fracture from her previous fall, so a social worker awards temporary custody of Amy to Jack. Roxy later is allowed to see Amy, whilst a social worker evaluates Roxy's parenting skills. Jack refuses to allow Roxy to see Amy other than at arranged times. A solicitor tells Roxy to dig up as much dirt on Jack and his family as she can, but this does not work as a court grants full custody to Jack. ===Development=== Robert Kazinsky who plays Sean Slater teased the Christmas storyline saying, "Sean ultimately deceives Roxy and snatches baby Amy from The Vic. Then there's a whole week of the Mitchells trying to track Sean and Amy down. Sean's holed up in a squat with the baby to give them more time together. He's simply looking after Amy, who's become the most important person in his life. Even if she isn't his child, mentally and emotionally, she is to Sean. Eventually, Sean's found and it all kicks off, culminating in a stunt with an icy lakeâ¦"{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/interviews/a137974/rob-kazinsky-sean-slater-eastenders.html|title=Rob Kazinsky (Sean Slater, 'EastEnders')|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=22 December 2008|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} Kazinsky said that he thinks Sean would be a good dad to Amy saying, Sean was 16 when his father died, so for Sean, bringing up baby Amy was a way for him to make it up to his dad - by being the father to Amy that his father was to him." {{-}} ==Ahmet== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Ahmet | image= | portrayer=[[Tamer Hassan]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2008|Former;guest]] | first= 5 December 2008 | last= 15 December 2008 | years= 2008 }} '''Ahmet''' played by [[Tamer Hassan]], is an ex-boyfriend of [[Suzy Branning]] ([[Maggie O'Neill]]). He makes his first appearance on 5 December 2008.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a136272/whitney-performs-in-the-christmas-play.html|title=Whitney performs in the Christmas play|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=5 December 2008|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} He made his last appearance on 15 December 2008.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a136731/suzy-comes-face-to-face-with-ex-ahmet.html|title=Suzy comes face-to-face with ex Ahmet|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=15 December 2008|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} He was described by the ''[[South Wales Evening Post]]'' as the 'evil ex of Suzy'.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thisissouthwales.co.uk/|title=EastEnders Suzy's heart threat|work=[[South Wales Evening Post]]|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[South Wales]]}} Suzy's dog, Prince, went missing but after she received a "special postcard" she immediately knew who had taken him. She met up with Ahmet in a cafe where it was revealed that the gold bar Suzy had originally had belonged to him and she stole it. On 15 December 2008, he returned, leaving a heart in a box on Suzy's doorstep. He later threatended her demanding that she give him the gold bar by the end of the day. [[Phil Mitchell]] ([[Steve McFadden]]) arranged to meet with him to make him back off, he handed him a wad of cash and in return, Ahmet gave Prince back. He later met up with Suzy in the park and revealed that Suzy had previously lied about a pregnancy with him. He gave her until Christmas to get the money she owed him. {{-}} ==Louise Hills== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Louise Hills | image= | portrayer=[[Adie Allen]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2009|Former;recurring]] | first=11 December 2008 | last=17 December 2009 | years=2008â09 | occupation=[[Sergeant]] }} '''Detective Sergeant Louise Hills''' played by [[Adie Allen]], is a sergeant who investigated the child abuse involving [[Tony King]] ([[Chris Coghill]]) and [[Whitney Dean]] ([[Shona McGarty]]). She initially appeared on 11 and 12 December 2008,{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a136276/angry-parents-confront-lucas.html|title=Angry parents confront Lucas|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=11 December 2008|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a136277/roxy-receives-the-dna-results.html|title=Roxy receives the DNA results|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=12 December 2008|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} and then appeared for three more episodes, on 5 February, 30 November and 17 December 2009.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a144396/danielle-confesses-her-shocking-secret-to-stacey.html|title=Danielle confesses her shocking secret to Stacey|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=5 February 2009|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a187183/maxs-plot-to-fleece-ian-takes-a-surprising-turn.html|title=Max's plot to fleece Ian takes a surprising turn|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=30 November 2009|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a189454/ian-signs-over-the-mitchells-loan.html|title=Ian signs over the Mitchells' loan|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=17 December 2009|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} She first appeared when she visited [[Bianca Jackson]] ([[Patsy Palmer]]) on 11 December 2008 to interview her and Whitney. Whilst there, [[Lauren Branning]] ([[Madeline Duggan]]) also came forward and told her the story of how Tony treated her. The next day, she returned to [[Pat Evans]]'s ([[Pam St Clement]]) house to let Bianca know that Tony had been released on police bail because Whitney hadn't given her statement. Whitney later gave her statement to the police and Tony was later charged. She returned to tell Whitney and Bianca that Tony had pleaded "Not Guilty" to the charges and she later informs them that Tony attempted suicide while in custody. She returned to tell Whitney that a verdict is expected on whether Tony will be sentenced. {{-}} =={{Anchor|Maria Leys}}Maria de Costa== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Maria de Costa | image= | portrayer=[[Judy Browne]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2009|Former; recurring]] | first=11 December 2008 | last= 6 December 2010 | years=2008â10 |alias=Maria Leys | occupation=[[Social worker]] }} '''Maria de Costa'''{{Cite episode |title=Maria de Costa (13/9/10)|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00tqr6g |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Karl Neilson; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Wendy Granditer |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=13 September 2010}} (previously '''Leys''') played by [[Judy Browne]], is a social worker who visits [[Whitney Dean]] ([[Shona McGarty]]) following her abuse by [[Tony King]] ([[Chris Coghill]]). She makes her first appearance on 11 December 2008 and returns on 20 January 2009.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a141253/janine-starts-work-at-rr.html|title=Janine starts work at R&R|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=20 January 2009|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} She reappears on 13 September and then on 30 September and then once again on 23 November.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a275862/shirley-vows-to-stand-by-phil.html|title=Shirley vows to stand by Phil|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=13 September 2010|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a276812/a-furious-stacey-attacks-janine.html|title=A furious Stacey attacks Janine|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=30 September 2010|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a287751/ian-discovers-janes-intentions.html|title=Ian discovers Jane's intentions|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=23 November 2010|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} Her last appearance was on 6 December 2010.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a290395/stacey-and-ryan-arouse-janines-suspicions.html|title=Stacey and Ryan arouse Janine's suspicions|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=6 December 2010|accessdate=19 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} She informs [[Tanya Branning]] ([[Jo Joyner]]) that her daughter [[Lauren Branning]] ([[Madeline Duggan]]) wanted to remain in care. She visits [[Stacey Branning]] ([[Lacey Turner]]) and her baby [[Lily Branning]], and notes that Stacey appears agitated. She visits Stacey again after [[Janine Malloy]] ([[Charlie Brooks]]) reports Stacey for neglecting Lily. However, Maria concludes that Lily is not being neglected. She returns and comes to see Stacey for a home visit, not knowing that Stacey has gone missing with Lily. She visits again where [[Ryan Malloy]] ([[Neil McDermott]]) pretends to be Stacey's partner. Maria is so impressed that she says she will not need to visit Stacey again. {{-}} ==Paul== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders | name=Paul | image= | portrayer=[[Jack Gordon (actor)|Jack Gordon]] | introducer=[[Diederick Santer]] | classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2009|Former;recurring]] | years=2008â09 | first=23 December 2008 | last= 9 March 2009 | occupation=[[Barman]] }} '''Paul''',{{Cite news|url=http://www.nowmagazine.co.uk/gallery/gallery-specials/10873/2/3/eastenders-stacey-branning-s-love-triangle-ends-in-a-fight/1/|title=EastEnders' Stacey Branning's love triangle ends in a fight|work=[[NOW (British magazine)|Now]]|accessdate=20 April 2011}} played by [[Jack Gordon (actor)|Jack Gordon]], is a barman who [[Ronnie Mitchell]] ([[Samantha Womack]])employed to help run R&R for a Christmas Party. He made various appearances, between December 2008,{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a137534/jane-throws-ian-out.html|title=Jane throws Ian out|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=23 December 2008|accessdate=20 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a139012/ronnie-discovers-danielles-secret.html|title=Ronnie discovers Danielle's secret|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=15 January 2009|accessdate=20 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a147121/archies-attentions-turn-to-janine.html|title=Archie's attentions turn to Janine|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=3 March 2009|accessdate=20 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} and his last being on 9 March 2009.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a148270/danielle-threatens-stacey.html|title=Danielle threatens Stacey|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=9 March 2009|accessdate=20 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} He appears first when he gets [[Danielle Jones (EastEnders)|Danielle Jones]] ([[Lauren Crace]]) drunk and they sleep together. He reappeared taking her out on a date. Then he returned when Danielle discovered she was pregnant and met Paul to tell him but backed out when he told her that he already had a girlfriend. Paul re-appeared at an '80s theme night at R&R. He bumped into Danielle and her friend [[Stacey Slater]] ([[Lacey Turner]]), and offered to buy them a drink. Stacey later revealed to Paul that Danielle had aborted his baby. This made him feel guilty and realised that he should have supported her. Later he had a heart to heart with Stacey and told her about how he felt. However this led to them kissing, while a heartbroken Danielle looked on. He then later appeared when Stacey and Danielle were in the club with some boys Paul knew. Danielle spilt her drink on one of the boys and Paul appeared offering to buy her another one. At first she refused but then after Stacey butted in, she accepted his offer. When Stacey went outside to take a call from her mum, Paul talked to Danielle and apologized for the way he had behaved. He then walked her to the bar and confronted her about her abortion. He thanked her because he believed he was too young to be a dad. Danielle realised Stacey told him and threw her drink at Paul and Danielle walked out before disowning Stacey. {{-}} ==Dotty Cotton== {{main|Dotty Cotton}} '''Kirsty "Dotty" Cotton''', played by [[Molly Conlin]], is the daughter of [[Nick Cotton]] ([[John Altman (actor)|John Altman]]) and [[List of EastEnders characters (2010)#Sandy|Sandy]] ([[Caroline Pegg]]), and the granddaughter of [[Dot Cotton]] ([[June Brown]]).{{cite news|url=http://holysoap.channel5.com/eastenders/cast/dotty-cotton-247|title=Dotty Cotton|work=[[Holy Soap]]|publisher=[[Channel 5 (UK)|Channel 5]]|accessdate=7 May 2011}} She first appeared on 26 December 2008, and left on 23 February 2010 after finding out that Sandy is alive.{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a137587/roxy-is-devastated-to-find-baby-amy-missing.html|title=Roxy is devastated to find baby Amy missing|last=Green|first=Kris|date=26 December 2008|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=17 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a203376/zainab-gives-birth-to-a-baby-boy.html|title=Zainab gives birth to a baby boy|last=Green|first=Kris|date=23 February 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=2 April 2011|location=[[London]]}} Dotty's storylines mainly involved around her father devious ways. She assisted Nick in trying to kill her grandmother, Dot, by believing she was suffering form [[dementia]] and later trying to poision her, so Nick could get the money from her will. She later became friends with Dot, after Nick failed to kill her, and then later went on to make friends with [[Tiffany Butcher]]. Her final storyline was when Dotty's mother, Sandy, arrived which led her to leave [[Walford]] with her. {{-}} ==Others== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="font-size:90%" ! scope="col" | Character !
